article_text:
FRANKFURT—The German economy most likely continued to grow at a robust pace in the early part of this year following its strong expansion at the end of 2014, Germany’s central bank said Monday.

The Deutsche Bundesbank also foresaw “a continuation of the vigorous economic ascent” in the second quarter of the year. The main drivers of this are foreign demand, private consumption and, to a lesser extent, construction, it said.

...

og.description: The German economy most likely continued to grow at a robust pace in the early part of this year following its strong expansion at the end of 2014, its central bank said.
og.title: Bundesbank Sees Continued German Growth

article_metadata.author: Todd Buell

article_summary:
The Deutsche Bundesbank also foresaw “a continuation of the vigorous economic ascent” in the second quarter of the year.
FRANKFURT—The German economy most likely continued to grow at a robust pace in the early part of this year following its strong expansion at the end of 2014, Germany’s central bank said Monday.
The main drivers of this are foreign demand, private consumption and, to a lesser extent, construction, it said.
